taxon_name.authority: (Bigelow) Torrey ex de Candolle in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle

place_of_publication.publication_title: in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle, Prodr.

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe eupatorieae;genus eupatorium;species rotundifolium;variety ovatum

bio:treatment.description: Leaf blades 3-nerved distal to bases, 30–70 × 30–60 mm, broadest near middles, bases broadly cuneate to cuneate, margins serrate. 2n = 20, 30.
Moist, low ground, roadsides, sandy soils;
Ala., Ark., Conn., Del., D.C., Fla., Ga., Ky., La., Md., Mass., Miss., N.H., N.J., N.Y., N.C., Ohio, Pa., R.I., S.C., Tenn., Va., W.Va.
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety ovatum is an apomictic polyploid that may be a derivative of Eupatorium rotundifolium and E. sessilifolium. Morphologically, it is closer to E. rotundifolium than to E. sessilifolium; the name E. pubescens has priority at species rank.
